messages.messageBody:
>
> > A few years ago I used to read and post on the Unschooling.com (I
> > think) forum, which had Sandra Dodd posting frequently.
> >
> > I'd like to find that forum and read and post there, vs using the

Unschooling.com has been gone for years and years. Unschooling.info started in it's place but I don't use it anymore....If you want to use yahoogroups, right here would make the most sense.

Ren
radicalunschooling.blogspot.com

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Where is the old forum for unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: ... The forums were (still are in a ghost town way) at: http://www.unschooling.info/forum/ The archives are still there but the most frequent posters are
messages.messageBody:
On Sep 4, 2009, at 3:47 AM, indiamommy wrote:

> A few years ago I used to read and post on the Unschooling.com (I
> think) forum, which had Sandra Dodd posting frequently.
>
> I'd like to find that forum and read and post there, vs using the
> yahoogroups. Is that still possible?


The forums were (still are in a ghost town way) at:

http://www.unschooling.info/forum/

The archives are still there but the most frequent posters are
spammers. (We catch them before they appear, but still ...) The board
was down with technical problems for a month or so and people drifted
away and never drifted back when it returned.

It could be The Radical Unschoolers Network started up at that time
and that filled the gap with a lot more style :-) It's a fairly
lively place with message boards, groups, personal pages, blogs and
familiar faces :-)

http://familyrun.ning.com/

Joyce

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Where is the old forum for unschooling?

messages.messageBody:
A few years ago I used to read and post on the Unschooling.com (I think) forum, which had Sandra Dodd posting frequently.

I'd like to find that forum and read and post there, vs using the yahoogroups. Is that still possible?

Please let me know by emailing me at Indiamommy@...

Thanks so much!
